content.raw:
I am still catching up with the architecture of the new Ignition Gazebo, but I am bit confused by the naming of this PR.   
In classic Gazebo, the JointController was a class used to simulate a low-level PID controller acting at the joint level \(see [http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=set\_velocity#SetJointVelocityUsingPIDcontrollers](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=set_velocity#SetJointVelocityUsingPIDcontrollers)\), that was clearly separate from the API to bypass the physics engine integrator and directly set the   
velocity of the joint. If I understand correctly, instead  in the new Ignition Gazebo the JointController is a system that permits to directly set the   
joint velocity \(similar to Classic Gazebo  `Joint::SetVelocity()` API\). There is any specific reason for this?
